actions.text: House Committee on Appropriations Reported an Original Measure. Report No: 99-2.
Placed on Union Calendar No: 3.
House Committee on Appropriations Reported an Original Measure. Report No: 99-2 (Part II).
Committee on Rules Granted a Rule Waiving all Points of Order Against Consideration of the Bill for Failure to Comply with the Provisons of Clause 2 of Rule XXI.
Rules Committee Resolution H.Res.86 Reported to House.
Rule Passed House.
Called up by House by Rule.
Passed House by Voice Vote.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Appropriations.
Committee on Appropriations. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.
Committee on Appropriations. Reported to Senate by Senator Hatfield with amendments. With written report No. 99-8.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 12.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Passed Senate with amendments by Yea-Nay Vote. 98-1. Record Vote No: 21.
Senate insists on its amendments, asks for a conference, appoints conferees Hatfield; Stevens; Cochran; Kasten; Stennis; Inouye; Burdick.
House Disagreed to Senate Amendments by Unanimous Consent.
House Agreed to Request for Conference and Speaker Appointed Conferees: Whitten, Natcher, Obey, Traxler, McHugh, Conte, Kemp, Smith (NE).
Conferees agreed to file conference report.
Conference Report 99-29 Filed in House.
House Agreed to Conference Report by Yea-Nay Vote: 400 - 19 (Record Vote No: 40).
House Receded and Concurred in Senate Amendment 013.
House Receded and Concurred With an Amendment in Senate Amendments 002, 006, 008, 009, 014.
Conference report considered in Senate.
Senate agreed to conference report by Voice Vote.
Senate agreed to House amendment to Senate amendments 2, 6, 8, 9, and 14. By Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 99-10.

official_title: A bill making urgent supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1985, for emergency relief and recovery in Africa, and for other purposes.

summary.as: House receded and concurred with amendment
summary.text: (House receded and concurred in certain Senate amendments with an amendment) Title I - Makes supplemental appropriations for FY 1985 for: (1) Public Law 480 for agricultural commodities for African famine relief programs, provided that funds shall be available for inland transportation if the Administrator of the Agency for International Development (AID) certifies that without such funds the delivery of emergency food would be impossible or inappropriately delayed; (2) AID for international disaster assistance in Africa provided such assistance shall remain available until March 31, 1986, and shall be available for carrying out basic agricultural rehabilitation and provided the congressional appropriations committees are notified five days before the obligation of any such sums; (3) AID for operating expenses in Africa; and (4) the Department of State for the U.S. Emergency Refugee and Migration Assistance Fund and for migration and refugee assistance in Africa, provided the migration and refugee assistance funds shall remain available until March 31, 1986. Title II - Makes supplemental appropriations to remain available through FY 1986 for Public Law 480 famine relief programs as an Emergency Reserve for African Famine Relief. Title III - Sets forth general provisions governing the use of funds appropriated by this Act. Directs the Secretary of Agriculture to make available for calendar year 1985, through private voluntary organizations, to African nations not less than 200,000 metric tons of farm commodities. Requires at least 50 percent of such commodities to be in the form of wheat or wheat products. Requires the Secretary of Agriculture, before such commodities are made available, to certify to specified congressional committees that such commodities shall not be distributed through or come under the control of the Government of Ethiopia.

titles.title: A bill making urgent supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1985, for emergency relief and recovery in Africa, and for other purposes.
